column1: #Text=[0077] In this example, the cobalt nanoparticles obtained from "Preparation of cobalt nanoparticles" method as described above in paragraph 59, were used as the first metal.
#Text=The cobalt nanoparticles were dissolved in 40 ml of nonane to make a 0.1 M solution.
#Text=Separately, 0.14 g of Pt(hfac)2 and 0.06 ml of dodecylisocyanate were added to 5 ml of nonane.
#Text=To this solution, 5 ml of the previously prepared nonane solution of cobalt was added and heated to 150.degree.
#Text=[0078] The solution was cooled to room temperature.
#Text=Ethanol was added thereto arid centrifuged at 3000 RPM for 20 minutes to separate precipitates.

#Text=[0079] FIG. 3A shows a photograph, taken using EM912 Omega, a transmission electron microscope (TEM) at electron beam of 120 KV, of the core-shell type cobalt-platinum nanoparticles MM*.sub.c produced according to this example.

#Text=FIG. 3B shows a photograph, taken using Hitachi H9000-NAR, a high resolution TEM at electron beam of 300 KV, for the core-shell type cobalt-platinum nanoparticles MM*.sub.c produced according to this example.
